title: European Communities Act (No. 27 of 1972) hereby make the following
heading: 1. These Regulations may be cited as the European Union (Control of
text_raw:
1. These Regulations may be cited as the European Union (Control of 

Exports of Personal Protective Equipment) Regulations 2020.
text_norm: 1 regulation may cited european union (control export personal protective equipment) regulation 2020

title: European Communities Act (No. 27 of 1972) hereby make the following
heading: 2. (1) In these Regulations–
text_raw:
2. (1) In these Regulations– 

i 

Implementing 

“Commission 
Regulation” means 
Commission Implementing Regulation (EU) 2020/402 of 
14 March 20201 making the exportation of certain 
products subject 
the production of an export 
authorisation. 

to 

ii 

 “Minister” means the Minister for Business, Enterprise 
and Innovation. 

(2) A word or expression used in these Regulations and which is also used 
in the Commission Implementing Regulation has, unless the context otherwise 
requires, the same meaning in these Regulations as it has in the Commission 
Implementing Regulation.

title: European Communities Act (No. 27 of 1972) hereby make the following
heading: (a) An application for an authorisation under Regulation 4 must be
text_raw:
5. 

(a) An application for an authorisation under Regulation 4 must be 
made in accordance with the form specified in Schedule 1. 

(b) Applications will be processed within a period of five working 
days from the date on which all required information has been 
provided to the Minister. 

(c) 

In accordance with Article 2(2) of the Council Implementing 
Regulation, the Minister may extend the application processing 
time by a 
in exceptional 
circumstances. 

five working days 

further

title: European Communities Act (No. 27 of 1972) hereby make the following
heading: 10. Declaration
text_raw:
10. Declaration 

I, the undersigned, certify that the information provided in this application is 
true and given in good faith, and that I am established in the Union. 

Name of applicant (BLOCK LETTERS):__________________________________ 

Signature: ____________________________Date: __________________ 

Contact Telephone No: _________________ 

PLEASE TYPE THE REQUIRED INFORMATION ONTO THE FORM AND 
RETURN A SCANNED COPY OF YOUR SIGNED FORM TO: 
(exportcontrol@dbei.gov.ie) 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 6 [84] 

Explanatory note to the export authorisation application form 

The completion of all the boxes is mandatory except when stated otherwise. 

Box 1 

Exporter details 

Box 2 

Recipient details 

Box 3 

Destination Country 

Box 4 

Commodity Code 

Full name and address of the exporter for 
whom the authorisation is issued and EORI 
number if applicable. 

Full name and address of the final recipient 
of the goods, if known at the time of 
issuance and EORI number if applicable. If 
the final recipient is not known at the time 
of issuance, the field is left empty. 

2-letter geonomenclature code of 
the 
country of destination of the goods for 
which the authorisation is issued. 

The numerical code from the Harmonised 
System or the Combined Nomenclature 
under which the goods to export are 
classified when the authorisation is issued. 

Box 5 

Description of goods Plain language description precise enough 

to allow identification the goods. 

Box 6 

Quantity 

Box 7 

Unit 

Box 8 

Location 

The quantity of goods measured in the unit 
declared in box 7. 

The measurement unit in which the quantity 
declared in box 8 is expressed. The units to 
use are "P/ST" for goods counted by 
number of pieces (e.g. masks), and "PA" 
for goods counted by pairs (e.g. gloves). 

If the protective equipment is located in one 
or more Member States other than Ireland, 
please indicate that fact by including the 
geonomenclature code of the Member State 
where the goods are located. If the goods 
are located in Ireland, this box must be left 
empty. 

Box 9 

Information relevant 
to Article 2(3) 

Information relevant to the considerations 
laid out in Article 2(3) of Commission 
Implementing Regulation (EU) 2020/402. 

Box 10 

Declaration 

Declaration that the information provided 
in the form is true and given in good faith. 

 
 
 [84] 7
